title: [BUG] floating point round is not identical to Apache Spark
body:
**Describe the bug**
When running TPCDS-Q78 in the integration tests against scale factor 1 data with decimals the ratio value comes back different than expected.

We get back a `0.57` vs a `0.58` for ratio on line 66. I'll try to debug this more and see what I can come up with.

This turned out to be how Spark implements round vs how cudf does it. I personally think that cudf is more correct than the java/spark version but that is kind of irrelevant.  Round for floating point has been disable by default in #1609. So this is going to wait until we have a customer that has to have this or until we can figure out how to make ll the crazy java conversions happen.

**Steps/Code to reproduce bug**
For now there is a slight bug in the code and you need to apply 

```diff
diff --git a/integration_tests/src/main/python/conftest.py b/integration_tests/src/main/python/conftest.py
index 8339f0bb..54a3bcdb 100644
--- a/integration_tests/src/main/python/conftest.py
+++ b/integration_tests/src/main/python/conftest.py
@@ -371,7 +371,7 @@ class TpcdsRunner:
     }
     if not self.tpcds_format in formats:
         raise RuntimeError("{} is not a supported tpcds input type".format(self.tpcds_format))
-    formats.get(self.tpcds_format)(jvm_session, self.tpcds_path, True)
+    formats.get(self.tpcds_format)(jvm_session, self.tpcds_path, True, True)
 
   def do_test_query(self, query):
     spark = get_spark_i_know_what_i_am_doing()
```

**Expected behavior**
The test should pass
